Learn Node Part 7: Browserify

Saturday, February 14, 2015

Overview

NodeJS has the most amazing package manager, npm that allows you to install modules easily. After installing a module, you can simply require it by doing require(‘moduleName’). Wouldn’t it be great if you could do that on the client side too? Using browserify, you can.

You can find more information here.

Installation

Step 1

 1 ### Command Line ###
 2 
 3 # Get the right packages
 4 npm install -g grunt-cli
 5 
 6 npm install --save-dev bower
 7 npm install --save-dev debowerify
 8 
 9 npm install --save-dev load-grunt-tasks
10 npm install --save-dev grunt
11 npm install --save-dev grunt-contrib-clean
12 npm install --save-dev grunt-browserify

Step 2

1 ### Command Line ###
2 
3 # Create a Gruntfile.js
4 touch Gruntfile.js
5 touch bower.json
6 touch .bowerrc

Step 3

 1 // ### in bower.json ###
 2 {
 3     "name": "Server14Browserify",
 4     "version": "0.0.1",
 5     "dependencies": {}
 6 }
 7 
 8 // ### in .bowerrc ###
 9 {
10     "directory": "public/bower_components"
11 }

Step 4

1 // ### in package.json ###
2 
3 // add the following
4 "browserify" : {
5   "transform": ["debowerify"]
6 }

Step 5

 1 // ### in Gruntfile.js ###
 2 
 3 module.exports = function(grunt) {
 4   require('load-grunt-tasks')(grunt);
 5   grunt.initConfig({
 6     // will clean
 7     clean: {
 8         build: {
 9             src: ['public/javascripts/build.js']
10         }
11     },
12 
13     // will browserify all the js files
14     browserify: {
15         client: {
16             src: ['public/javascripts/**/*.js'],
17             dest: 'public/javascripts/build.js'
18         }
19     }
20   });
21 
22   grunt.registerTask('default', ['clean', 'browserify:client']);
23 };

Step 6

 1 // ### in public/javascripts/index.js ###
 2 
 3 // you can now require node modules or bower modules, or even other js files
 4 var unique = require('uniq');
 5 var $ = require("jquery");
 6 
 7 var data = [1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 5, 5, 6];
 8 
 9 console.log($("body").html());
10 console.log(unique(data));

Step 7

1 ### in Command Line ###
2 
3 # running this will generate a build.js file
4 # that contains all the js you need (jquery + uniq + index.js)
5 # to use it, simply make a script with that file as the src
6 grunt

How to use

After installing the modules you want to use (using bower or npm), you simply require them in your file

 1 // ### in public/javascripts/index.js ###
 2 
 3 var unique = require('uniq');               // node module
 4 var $ = require('jquery');                  // bower module
 5 var sayMyName = require('./sayMyName');     // own module
 6 
 7 var data = [1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 5, 5, 6];
 8 
 9 console.log("'Uniq' node module", unique(data));
10 console.log("'jQuery' bower module", $('body').html());
11 console.log("'sayMyName', own module", sayMyName());

To make your own file into a module, you use module.exports like you would in node

1 // ### in public/javascripts/sayMyName.js ###
2 
3 module.exports = function(){
4     return "This is sparta";
5 };
